Breeding male.description: Northern Shovelers have a bill that is noticeably larger and wider than a mallard with a white (not brown) chest and chestnut sides.

Female/immature.description: Northern Shovelers have a bill that is noticeably larger and wider than a mallard. Females do not have the dark crown patch that female Mallards have.

Female.description: Female Mottled Ducks have a unmarked buffy face whereas female Mallards have a darker face.

Male.description: Mottled Ducks are slightly darker and don't have the broad white borders to the speculum seen on Mallards. They also have a black spot at the base of the bill and an unmarked buffy face that Mallards lack.

Female.description: American Black Ducks have a darker body, a greenish-yellow bill, and a purplish speculum patch in the wings that does not have white borders like Mallards.

Male.description: American Black Duck has a darker body, a greenish-yellow bill, and a purplish speculum patch in the wings that does not have white borders like Mallards.

Breeding male.description: Mergansers are streamlined ducks with long, slender bills. Mergansers also behave differently, diving instead of dabbling.
Mergansers are streamlined ducks with long, slender bills. Mergansers also behave differently, diving instead of dabbling.
